bestBHT.bht: Abraham's faith brought glory to God as he firmly believed in God's ability to fulfill his promises and was fully assured, with no doubts shaking his conviction. This unwavering trust in God's power is the essence of faith. By having confidence in God's word and a full persuasion of His ability to do the seemingly impossible, we honor God and His grace. Abraham's faith rested upon the power of God, who is capable of overcoming any obstacle.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: the glory which Abraham's faith gave to God
firm in the persuasion of God's ability to fulfil his promise
Albert Barnes: And being fully persuaded - Thoroughly or entirely convinced."
His faith was equally implicit and strong when he was commanded to sacrifice his promised son; Hebrews 11:19.
Marvin Vincent: The primary idea is, being filled with a thought or conviction.
John Calvin: There is in deed no obstacle, however small and insignificant, by which the flesh imagines the hand of God is restrained from working.

That it may obtain from us its right and its honor, when a contest comes, we ought to determine thus, — That it is no less sufficient to overcome the obstacles of the world, than the strong rays of the sun are to dissipate the mists.
And it is a proof of the unbelief, of which he had before spoken, when we mete the Lord’s power with our own measure.
Philip Schaff: This simple confidence in God’s promise gave glory to God, and is the essence of faith.
Confidence in God’s word, a full persuasion that He can do what seems to us impossible, is as necessary in the one case as in the other.
The sinner honors God, in trusting His grace, as much as Abraham did in trusting His power.
Archibald T. Robertson: What he had promised...according to usual Greek idiom.
He was able...used in sense of the verb.
John Gill: He had not only faith, a strong faith, but full assurance of faith.
Though it was so long ago, and there were so many difficulties in the way.
His faith rested upon the power of God, with whom nothing is impossible.

bhtAttempts.bht: Abraham's faith was unwavering and strong, bringing glory to God, as he firmly believed in God's ability to fulfill his promises. He was fully assured and settled in his conviction, with no doubts or obstacles shaking his confidence. This deep conviction and trust in God's power is the essence of faith. Abraham's faith was not just a simple confidence; it was a complete persuasion that God could do what seemed impossible. His faith rested upon the power of God, with whom nothing is impossible. By trusting in God's grace and His ability to overcome any obstacle, we too can bring glory to God and honor His word.

Abraham's faith brought glory to God as he firmly believed in God's ability to fulfill his promises and was fully assured, with no doubts shaking his conviction. This unwavering trust in God's power is the essence of faith. By having confidence in God's word and a full persuasion of His ability to do the seemingly impossible, we honor God and His grace. Abraham's faith rested upon the power of God, who is capable of overcoming any obstacle.

Abraham's unshakable faith in God's ability to fulfill His promises brought glory to Him. His conviction was unwavering, fully assured, and free from doubts or obstacles. This faith, grounded in the power of God, is the essence of trust and honors God's grace. By having complete confidence in God's word and a firm persuasion of His capability to accomplish the seemingly impossible, we show our faith and bring glory to Him. Nothing is beyond the reach of God, and our faith should rest upon His mighty power.

Abraham's faith gave glory to God by being fully persuaded and firm in his belief in God's ability to fulfill His promises. His confidence in God's power remained unshaken, undeterred by any difficulties or obstacles. Abraham's faith rested upon the mighty power of God, who is capable of achieving the extraordinary. By demonstrating a deep conviction and trust in God's word, we honor Him and show our faith. We should fully rely on God's power, for nothing is impossible for Him.

Abraham's faith, fully assured and unwavering, brought glory to God as he firmly believed in His ability to fulfill His promises. His conviction remained unshaken, undeterred by any difficulties or obstacles. By being fully persuaded of God's power, Abraham's faith was a testament to His trustworthiness. We are called to have the same confidence in God's word, acknowledging that nothing is impossible for Him. In doing so, we honor and glorify God, showing our reliance on His mighty power.
